result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan James Goetsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Any vehicles titled and registered in the Defendant's name are Ordered to have IID installed.  IID is Ordered on Defendant himself.
Install within 14 days.

miscConds.notes:
Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO or OWI Court team.
Be in full compliance with and successfully complete the Marathon County OWI Treatment Court. 
Be in full compliance with IID Order, Revocation Order and Drivers Safety Plan.

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 6 months; Impose and Stay 3 Months for rule violations if any.
w/Huber for work and treatment, if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to commence at discretion of PO but within 45 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alan James Goetsch

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Cases 14CF342, 14CF401 and 14TR1659 called: 8:48am
State appears by ADA K.Mayo.  Def appears in person and with Atty Dan Cveykus.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State moves to:
14CF401>>D&RI entire file
14CF342 - Ct. 2 (Hit and Run)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE
State also moves the COURT in 14TR1659 to find the refusal lawful, and also dismiss any related PAC citation - COURT also grants these requests.

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 (OWI 5th)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty

COURT ORDERS: 6 years TOTAL: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES, I&S; 3 years Probation
CONDITIONS: Be in full compliance with and successfully complete the Marathon County OWI treatment court; Be in compliance w/IID order, revocation order, and drivers safety plan; 9 months MCJ--6 months to be served, and remaining 3 months I&S for rules violations if any, w/credit for 5 days of time already served, w/huber for work and treatment, if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, to commence at discretion of PO but within 45 days; $600+CC; 30 month DL revocation;   Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 30 months; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid;Half-Priced IID ordered as defendant qualifie; AODA (completed already); Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO or OWI court team.

Defendant qualifies for SAP but does NOT qualify for CIP

>>>$5,000 cash posted to be returned to surety, and $500 posted by defendant to be used for court costs
>>>Revocation commences at 2:00pm today 

Adj: 9:05am
Plea hearing on September 12, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Status conference on September 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2014 at 10:50 am.
